title: Emilio Aguinaldo
description: Emilio Aguinaldo, (born March 22/23, 1869, near Cavite, Luzon, Philippinesâ€”died February 6, 1964, Quezon City), Filipino leader and politician who fought first against Spain and later against the United States for the independence of the Philippines.

title: Aguinaldo's Achievements
description: Emilio Aguinaldo led a revolutionary movement against the Spanish colonial government in the Philippines. He cooperated with the U.S. during the Spanish-American War but subsequently broke with the U.S. and led a guerrilla campaign against U.S. authorities during the Philippine-American War.
